meta.title: Research
meta.description: Peer-reviewed research advancing the science of universal data representation and decentralized infrastructure.

papers.title: Universal Data Representation: A Framework for Interoperable Systems
papers.abstract: We present a comprehensive framework for universal data representation that enables seamless interoperability across heterogeneous systems. Our approach leverages semantic web technologies and category theory to establish a formal foundation for data exchange.

papers.title: Decentralized Identity Management Using Universal Object References
papers.abstract: This paper introduces a novel approach to decentralized identity management using Universal Object References (UOR). We demonstrate how UOR primitives can provide self-sovereign identity while maintaining privacy and security guarantees.
papers.venue: IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy

papers.title: Semantic Interoperability in Distributed AI Systems
papers.abstract: We explore semantic interoperability challenges in distributed AI systems and propose solutions using UOR. Our work enables collaborative model training and inference across organizational boundaries while preserving data sovereignty.

papers.title: Efficient Cross-Chain Data Transfer with Universal Schemas
papers.abstract: We present an efficient protocol for cross-chain data transfer using universal schemas. Our approach reduces overhead by 75% compared to existing bridge solutions while maintaining security properties.

papers.title: Category Theory Foundations for Universal Data Systems
papers.abstract: This work establishes rigorous mathematical foundations for universal data systems using category theory. We prove key properties about composability, transformation, and preservation of semantic meaning.

papers.title: Quantum-Resistant Cryptography for Decentralized Data Infrastructure
papers.abstract: We analyze quantum computing threats to decentralized data systems and propose quantum-resistant cryptographic schemes. Our implementation provides post-quantum security while maintaining performance.
